knimeNode.name: MovingHyperplane
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates n-dimensional data with drifting concepts based on a moving hyperplane.

fullDescription.intro: The algorithm creates a hyperplane in an n-dimensional space and assigns a class to random data points by checking on which side of the hyperplane they are. To simulate concept drifts the hyperplane is moved after every creation of a data point. The exact algorithm can be found in the paper "Mining Concept-Drifting Data Streams using Ensemble Classifiers" (see http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=956778) under the section "6.2 Streaming Data".
fullDescription.option: Number of data points which will be created
Dimensionality of the data points which will be created
Specifies the total number of dimensions whose weights are involved in changing the hyperplane
Specifies the magnitude of the change (every N examples) for weights
Seed for the random generator used in this program (same seed produces the same results)

ports.outPort: n-dimensional point data with a class label
